history.content: Not a problem at all. The application knows which grades to factor in based on your first term. For example, if you started at UCB in Fall '15 or later and entered a grade for CS61C, it wouldn't calculate that either. We also verify the grades and the term when you started. Math 54 won't be considered in your declaration if you started Fall '15 or later, but you do need to pass Math 54 for your CS requirements.

children.subject: Along similar lines, my first term was Fall 2015, so I only entered grades for 61a/b and 70. However, I have met most of the lower div graduation requirements (math 1a/b, math 54, cs 70), but I just figured that I didn't need to enter grades for them considering they did not factor in to my gpa requirement. Is this okay, as well?

history.content:
Hi! When I submitted my application I included my Math 54 grade even though I started in Fall 15 so this was not necessary to declare. In the three actual requirements (61a/b and 70) I have a higher GPA. When considering my declaration are the reviewers going to take my Math 54 grade into account which results in a lower CS GPA? I'm really worried that I should have not included it!

Thank you.
history.subject: Declaration unnecessary pre-req?
